title: Stardew Valley: How to Catch & Use Walleye for Bundles, Quests, & More

steps.title: Wait until rainy days in Fall.
steps.content: Wait until rainy days in Fall. Walleye can be caught in Fall during rainy days. You can also catch Walleye during the Winter if you use a Rain Totem. There are a few exceptions to this, however, though they require game progression or gold: [1] X Research source If you have access to Qi's Walnut Room, you can buy Magic Bait that allows you to catch any fish regardless of the weather, time, or season. You can purchase Magic Bait for 5 Qi Gems, as well as the recipe for Magic Bait for 20 Qi Gems. [2] X Research source Walleye can randomly (and rarely) be found in Garbage Cans during Fall and Winter. You can also rarely find Walleye for sale in the Traveling Cart for 315 to 1,000 gold.

steps.title: Go to the river, Mountain Lake, or Cindersap Forest Pond between 12 p.m.
steps.content: Go to the river, Mountain Lake, or Cindersap Forest Pond between 12 p.m. and 2 a.m. Walleye are most commonly found in the Cindersap Forest Pond, where every cast has a 32% chance of catching a Walleye. You can also catch a Walleye on your farm if you chose the Riverland Farm or Forest Farm.

steps.title: Go fishing.
steps.content: Go fishing. Walleye is not the most common fish to catch , but with a little patience and dedication you'll catch one in no time. And thankfully, Walleye has the Smooth behavior during the fishing mini-game, which means it's got a steady (and therefore slightly less difficult) movement pattern. [3] X Research source

steps.title: Three recipes can be made with Walleye.
steps.content: Three recipes can be made with Walleye. However, these recipes do not require Walleye specifically, so you may want to use your Walleye for other purposes. The recipes you can use Walleye in are as follows: [4] X Research source Maki Roll: 1 Fish (any), 1 Seaweed, 1 Rice Quality Fertilizer: 1 Fish (any), 2 Sap Sashimi: 1 Fish (any)

steps.title: Walleye is used in a Community Center Bundle.
steps.content: Walleye is used in a Community Center Bundle. Walleye is one of the fish you must submit for the Night Fishing Community Center Bundle in the Fish Tank. [5] X Research source If you're playing with remixed bundles, one gold or iridium quality Walleye is required for the Quality Fish Bundle in the Fish Tank.

steps.title: Walleye can be used to create clothing.
steps.content: Walleye can be used to create clothing. If you put a Walleye in the Sewing Machine, you can make a Fishing Vest. [6] X Research source It can also be used as yellow dye in the Dye Pots in Emily and Haley's house.

steps.title: One Walleye may be requested in Fall or Winter at the Help Wanted Board.
steps.content: One Walleye may be requested in Fall or Winter at the Help Wanted Board. Completing this quest will get you a reward of 315 gold and 150 friendship points towards the poster. [7] X Research source

steps.title: Walleye can be placed in the Fish Pond, where they will reproduce.
steps.content: Walleye can be placed in the Fish Pond, where they will reproduce. You can initially place 3 Walleye in your Fish Pond, but if you complete three quests you can store up to 10. Walleye will reproduce every 3 days. The only item you can harvest from Walleye is Walleye Roe, which is yellow in color (not to be confused with Sturgeon Roe , which is black). [8] X Research source

steps.title: You can use Walleye as a gift.
steps.content: You can use Walleye as a gift. While it's not an ideal use of the fish, you can give Walleye as a gift to Demetrius, Elliot, Leo, Linus, Pam, Sebastian, and Willy, who will all have a neutral reaction to receiving this gift. All other villagers dislike or hate Walleye as a gift, and you should avoid giving it to them.
